title: Neighbours spoilers: Sex tape scandal and sad exit ahead
text:
Spoilers for the week ahead in Neighbours (Picture: Channel 5)

There are tough times ahead for our favourite Neighbours, not least for one family who face losing a member.

The Brennans have a monumental decision to make when they get heartbreaking news about Fay’s (Zoe Bertrum) condition. One of them has to step up, but who will decide to leave Ramsay Street?

Scarlett (Christie Whelan Browne) has Ned (Ben Hall) completely fooled and sees an opportunity to get exactly what she wants and could lead Ned to doing something he will most definitely regret. Will she manage to come between Ned and Yashvi (Olivia Junkeer)?

And one couple finds themselves at the centre of a sex tape scandal that could ruin Lassiters!

1. The Brennans’ bad news means huge changes

Are the Brennans about to say goodbye? (Picture: Channel 5)

Mark, Chloe and Aaron are beside themselves over Fay’s disappearance, but just when they lose hope they learn she’s been found and their fear turns to joy. But their happiness is short lived. It becomes clear her Huntington’s has progressed significantly and her health is going rapidly down hill. She needs round the clock supervision and it’s proving too much for Piper and Tyler, so someone else is needed to help with her care. It gets Mark thinking – what’s left for him in Ramsay Street? Perhaps it’s time for him to leave…

2. Ned cheats with stalker Scarlett?

Scarlett is getting exactly what she wants (Picture: Channel 5)

Scarlett is gutted to realise Ned is pining after Yashvi and decides she needs to up her game. When she finds she has a free house she tells Ned her stalker ex is back and he comes to her rescue. It’s all a bit weird though when the police reveal they can’t find any evidence.

Ned, however, doesn’t twig, although Bea certainly has her suspicions considering she barely survived Scarlett’s last attempt at winning Ned. Scarlett’s game is nearly thwarted when Kyle confirms to Yashvi that Ned is missing her, forcing Scarlett to sneak into Ned’s house to delete Yashvi’s text before he sees it. She finds him asleep on the couch in his bathers, so she slips down to her bikini and joins him. But who should come over and see them apparently all wrapped up together? Yashvi of course. Chalk that up to a win for weirdo Scarlett.

3. Sex tape scandal hits Ramsay Street!

Paul and Terese arrive back to chaos at the same time as Amy and Kyle return from their steamy night alone at Lassiters. Roxy and Harlow are at each other’s throats for one and Paul and Terese come back to Earth with a bump as they catch up on what’s been going on for the last few weeks.

They’re interrupted by a call from Lassiters calling Terese to urgently come and sort a matter out. When she arrives at the hotel she discovers the plumber has found a secret hidden camera – aimed at the bed Amy and Kyle have spent the night in! Is this a remnant of Ryan Prescott’s reign of terror? As Terese tries to investigate without getting the police involved she thinks she’s sorted it all. That is until we see a mystery person watching a video of Kyle and Amy together getting frisky. Who is spying on them and why have they made a secret sex tape?!

4. Mackenzie’s heartbreak

Mackenzie faces a whole world of hurt thanks to her dad (Picture: Channel 5)

Mackenzie has been on a roller coaster ride trying to find her dad, and when Shane gets a sudden lead things look hopeful. After a slight disappointment when it appears the lead has gone nowhere, Shane is shocked when Grant suddenly gets in touch.

Mackenzie is overcome with nerves when she finally gets the chance to meet her dad and though it’s a rocky start, they manage to work through it to the point she’s willing to give him a chance. Later, Mackenzie makes a huge decision and invites her dad to the school formal. It’s a huge step in their relationship and it feels like they’re getting back on track. But her joy is short lived when the dance turns into a disaster; not only does a rejected Hendrix kiss someone in front of her, she’s gutted to realise Grant is a no show.

5. Ned’s reeled in

Bea for one seems to be able to see through Scarlett, and after Yashvi dumps Ned for catching him sleeping semi naked with Scarlett, she feels she has to act. Finn tries to tell her to keep out of it, but there’s just something about it all that doesn’t sit right – Ned would never cheat on Yashvi. She decides to confront Ned about the whole sorry affair, but before she can Scarlett interrupts with the latest from her ‘stalker’. She’s found a photo of herself in her locker with the eyes scratched out. Ned is completely taken in but Bea most definitely smells a rat. Could Bea be the key to bringing unhinged Scarlett down? Or could she once again be putting herself in harm’s way?

6. Pierce’s public shame

Hendrix gets his own back on his dad (Picture: Channel 5)

Hendrix is fuming after being rejected by Mackenzie and forces a kiss on Harlow, to the horror of his dad Pierce. Pierce is disgusted at Hendrix’s lack of understanding about the issue of consent over the kiss, Hendrix clearly has no respect for women, and Pierce’s horror is compounded when he learns of the damage Hendrix has done to a hotel room. So Hendrix does what he does best, goes into his childish mode, gets drunk and grabs the mic – telling everyone at the formal what a terrible father Pierce has been. Will anything stop this kid?!

Scenes air from Monday 7th October at 1.45pm and 5.30pm on Channel 5.
